The server I'm playing around on now allows alignment changes so I was looking at trading BG for Paladin in Valerfor's Moghedien build. (3rd post)

The only problem I'm having is deciding what to take for the 2 feats that I have free'd up now that I don't need to take PA and Cleave as prerequisites for BG.

I immediately thought of IKD/Expertise or Expertise/Imp.Expertise but this requires 13 Int.

I have shuffled things around a bit and managed to get the 13 Int while still maintaining a Str of 40 by dropping AS which I figure Expertise will make up for.

I was wondering if anyone had any suggestions/Improvements.

The main one I was considering was dropping Str to 38, which means at the loss of 1 AB and ESF:Perform I am gaining 2 AC (Armor Skin), 1 Int which gains me an extra skill in Taunt, and 1 to saves from 2 extra Cha.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You omitted any divine feats as well eh?

I don't blame you because with the amount of strength this build has, it isn't necessary, just a bonus on top of what i already had there. From the two builds i would chose the first one, as Mick said once " That 40 Strength is Sexy! ". But if i wanted to play somehting like your second build i would then include a divine feat or two as well because you would have an unbuffed 18 charisma already and it's a shame to not take advantage of it.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Two free feats?

depending on where you play, I'd use one of those for craft wand.

Know how many times a wand of invisibility can get you out of trouble?   wand use cannot be disrupted.  And a wand of Summon Monster 4 means you always have a distraction.  Wands of Ice Storm (bard may get it as a lvl 6 spell, but its a lvl 4 arcane spell so can be crafted.)

And if you play on WoG (World of Greyhawk) wands always have 50 charges and the spell power scales with caster level.  And can be recharged.   50 charges of grease in a wand can be loads of fun... not to mention darkness and Ultravision.  And ghostly visage for concealment and instant 5/1+ damage reduction that negates all lvl 1 spells...  no more pesky magic missile shaman casters...


Ayup... craft wand would get my vote...

but then again i've been accused of power gaming a time or two...

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
I realised that I somehow missed Curse Song so that makes up 1 of them.

Crafting feats are disabled where this is to be played so I figure I may as well just take expertise for the Taunt/Expertise combo.

As for the Divine feats, I have never taken them in any build before because they just seem so incredibly underwhelming.
